newsitem.title: DENMARK: FORECAST - Goldman Sachs see unchanged Danish 96 GDP.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Goldman Sachs see unchanged Danish 96 GDP.

text.p: In its latest survey U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs on Friday forecast Denmark's 1996 GDP (gross domestic product) growth rate would be 1.6 percent, identical to its last estimate in August.
At the same time it left unchanged its forecast for inflation at 2.0 percent and its expectations for the current account surplus at 10.5 billion crowns.

The latest Danish Economy Ministry forecast in August foresaw 1.8 percent GDP growth, 2.0 percent inflation, 9.0 percent unemployment and a current account surplus of 10.0 billion crowns for this year.
The following estimates were made by 10 leading local and international organisations.
